news_header: North Korea is demolishing the Mount Kumgang Reunion Center, a facility for families separated since the Korean War, prompting South Korea to condemn the act as inhumane.
news_original_title: N. Korea destroys meeting place for war-separated families
news_text: South Korea urges an immediate halt to the demolition, emphasizing that North Korea must take full responsibility. Over 133,600 South Koreans are registered as separated families, with around 36,000 still alive. Tensions between the two Koreas have escalated, with North Korea increasingly labeling South Korea as a hostile state.
